Description: Sherd of East Greek pottery pedestal or perhaps lid, mended from three fragments; pinkish buff highly micaceous clay; orange-red band on outside of foot/rim.
Curator's comments: The width of the upturn suggests that it is rather the stem of a peestal than the support of a knob or finial.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GN.74)
